About Yasca

Yasca is a multi-platform static analysis tool designed to help developers create high-quality, secure software. More information can be found at yasca.org.

Yasca Version: 3.0.5

The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/admin\/groups\/index.php","lineNumber":35,"message":"\t\t\t\t\t\t$qry = $conn->query(\"SELECT * from `group_list` where delete_flag = 0 order by `name` asc \");","unsafeSourceCode":{"25":"\t\t\t\t\t\t<th>Description<\/th>","26":"\t\t\t\t\t\t<th>Type<\/th>","27":"\t\t\t\t\t\t<th>Status<\/th>","28":"\t\t\t\t\t\t<th>Action<\/th>","29":"\t\t\t\t\t<\/tr>","30":"\t\t\t\t<\/thead>","31":"\t\t\t\t<tbody>","32":"\t\t\t\t\t<?php ","33":"\t\t\t\t\t\t$i = 1;","34":"\t\t\t\t\t\t$qry = $conn->query(\"SELECT * from `group_list` where delete_flag = 0 order by `name` asc \");","35":"\t\t\t\t\t\twhile($row = $qry->fetch_assoc()):","36":"\t\t\t\t\t?>","37":"\t\t\t\t\t\t<tr>","38":"\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td class=\"text-center\"><?php echo $i++; ?><\/td>","39":"\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td class=\"\"><?php echo date(\"Y-m-d H:i\",strtotime($row['date_created'])) ?><\/td>","40":"\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td class=\"\"><?php echo $row['name'] ?><\/td>","41":"\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td class=\"\"><p class=\"m-0 truncate-1\"><?php echo $row['description'] ?><\/p><\/td>","42":"\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td class=\"text-center\"><?= $row['type'] == 1 ? The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the in the database layer of an application. Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this Credentials","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"It is important to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/classes\/Master.php","lineNumber":163,"message":"\t\t\t$this->conn->query(\"DELETE FROM `journal_items` where journal_id = '{$jid}'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"153":"\t\tif(empty($id)){","154":"\t\t\t$sql = \"INSERT INTO `journal_entries` set {$data} \";","155":"\t\t}else{","156":"\t\t\t$sql = \"UPDATE `journal_entries` set {$data} where id = '{$id}' \";","157":"\t\t}","158":"\t\t$save = $this->conn->query($sql);","159":"\t\tif($save){","160":"\t\t\t$jid = !empty($id) ? $id : $this->conn->insert_id;","161":"\t\t\t$data = \"\";","162":"\t\t\t$this->conn->query(\"DELETE FROM `journal_items` where journal_id = '{$jid}'\");","163":"\t\t\tforeach($account_id as $k=>$v){","164":"\t\t\t\tif(!empty($data)) $data .=\", \";","165":"\t\t\t\t$data .= \"('{$jid}','{$v}','{$group_id[$k]}','{$amount[$k]}')\";","166":"\t\t\t}","167":"\t\t\tif(!empty($data)){","168":"\t\t\t\t$sql = \"INSERT INTO `journal_items` (`journal_id`,`account_id`,`group_id`,`amount`) VALUES {$data}\";","169":"\t\t\t\t$save2 = $this->conn->query($sql);","170":"\t\t\t\tif($save2){","171":"\t\t\t\t\t$resp['status'] = 'success';","172":"\t\t\t\t\tif(empty($id)){"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/classes\/Master.php","lineNumber":288,"message":"\t\t$del = $this->conn->query(\"DELETE FROM `reservation_list` where id = '{$id}'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"278":"\t\t}","279":"\t\t","280":"","281":"\t\tif($resp['status'] =='success')","282":"\t\t$this->settings->set_flashdata('success',$resp['msg']);","283":"\t\treturn json_encode($resp);","284":"\t}","285":"\tfunction delete_reservation(){","286":"\t\textract($_POST);","287":"\t\t$del = $this->conn->query(\"DELETE FROM `reservation_list` where id = '{$id}'\");","288":"\t\tif($del){","289":"\t\t\t$resp['status'] = 'success';","290":"\t\t\t$this->settings->set_flashdata('success',\"Reservation Details has been deleted successfully.\");","291":"\t\t}else{","292":"\t\t\t$resp['status'] = 'failed';","293":"\t\t\t$resp['error'] = $this->conn->error;","294":"\t\t}","295":"\t\treturn json_encode($resp);","296":"\t}","297":"\tfunction update_reservation_status(){"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for throttling or caching, this creates an opportunity for denial of service events","references":{"https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/613.html":"CWE-613: Insufficient Session Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for throttling or caching, this creates an opportunity for denial of service events","references":{"https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/613.html":"CWE-613: Insufficient Session scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue
